posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.79 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes (for the App Store):

  • We fixed a bug that caused the camera to appear blank when attempting to link a new device. Now the viewfinder will only look like that if you’re trying to link a new device in a really dark room.

In addition to our normal release, it’s the moment you’ve all been waiting for: we’re launching Backups to TestFlight beta.

It’s been a long journey to get here. While there’s a lot more to come (and we’re not sure when it’ll go to the App Store), we’re thrilled to have you, our first external audience, help us test Backups on iOS.

For details on the Backups feature and how it works, please refer to the Android beta release notes ( Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release ) as well as our blog post announcement ( Signal >> Blog >> Introducing Signal Secure Backups ).

Some things to note:

  • The paid tier of Backups is available for free to all TestFlight users, as long as you remain on TestFlight builds. In part, this is a workaround for the fact that Apple doesn’t let TestFlight builds do real-money transactions using their In-App Purchase system, which we’ll be using; it’s also a token of our appreciation for your work helping us make Signal better!

  • Backups is a cross-platform feature, and you should be able to restore your Backups on either a TestFlight iOS build, or an Android beta build. However, please note that using paid-tier Backups on Android will require a purchase.

Please let us know your experience, good and bad. If it works great, we’d love to hear about it and look at your debug logs; if you encounter issues, please report as usual. As a reminder, if you’re experiencing crashes please submit `.ips` files (https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591-Debug-Logs-and-Crash-Reports#ios_debug) with your bug report and debug logs, as they’re super helpful for debugging crashes.

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.79.0.1044-beta

47 new commits since 7.78.0.1035-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.79 [1]

  • Add prompt for multiple failed backup attempts [2]

  • Use UIMenuElements instead of UIActions [3]

  • Add backup failure UX [4]

  • Improve performance of orphan data cleaner [5]

  • Improve memory usage of orphan data cleaner [6]

  • Remove KeyValueStore.numberOfKeys(…) [7]

  • Remove KeyValueStore.allUIntValuesMap(…) [8]

  • Add NewKeyValueStore [9]

  • Remove “Faster Forwards” NUX [10]

  • Present options for muting / unmuting chat via UIMenu. […] [11]

  • UI to create a new poll [12]

  • Instead of propmting, use the restored SVR PIN after backup restore [13]

  • Replace usage of writeWithTxCompletion with writeWithRollbackIfThrows [14]

  • Guard donations more closely on isRegistered [15]

  • Backup Export progress bar polish [16]

  • Tidying of TSInfoMessage group updates [17]

  • Add TxContext to TimeGatedBatch [18]

  • Remove YYImage and update libwebp [19]

  • calling: Stop camera capture if call ended [20]

  • Update constants for iPhone Air [21]

  • Update libsignal to v0.81.1; enable permessage-deflate for chat.signal.org. [22]

  • Send a poll-create message [23]

  • store recent challenge [24]

  • Only flag canceled Backups as "failed" if in overnight mode [25]

  • Stop using InputAccessoryViewPlaceholder in text sharing screen. […] [26]

  • Clean up and fix layout issues in Edit Avatar screen. (#11990) […] [27]

  • Stop using InputAccessoryViewPlaceholder in group story reply sheet. […] [28]

  • Remove keyboard frame tracking from OWSViewController. […] [29]

  • Stop using InputAccessoryViewPlaceholder in media attachment review screen. […] [30]

  • Address registration design feedback [31]

  • Label for "no votes" in a poll [32]

  • Remove unused method [33]

  • Add PaddingBucket [34]

  • Modernize TSAccountManager’s KeyValueStore [35]

  • Move progress bars under Backup Details section [36]

  • Hide last backup size unless paid tier [37]

  • Run multiple media-tier deletes in parallel [38]

  • Respect global “Dark Theme Dims Wallpaper” setting [39]

  • Update QuickRestore to handle various restore paths [40]

  • Update FeatureFlags to expose Backups to beta builds [41]

  • Stop using InputAccessoryViewPlaceholder in chat. […] [42] (reverted by [47])

  • Drop duplicates for contact sync messages [43]

  • Update translations [44]

  • Revert "Fix Xcode 26 builds on CI" [45]

  • Revert "Switch to Xcode 26.0" [46]

  • Revert "Stop using InputAccessoryViewPlaceholder in chat. " [47] (reverts [42])

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.78.0.1035-beta…7.79.0.1044-beta

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: Chloe
posts.cooked:
There is a display issue when the “Increase Contrast” accessibility option is enabled and the user navigates to the backup settings menu. All contrast disappears.

Increase Contrast OFF740×1600 76.6 KB

Accessibility setting off ^
Increase Contrast ON740×1600 72.5 KB

Accessibility setting on ^

ETA: Debug logs https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.79.0/02631308f3ae77ec20defa4ac1cdea61d62e67a5f1d14de6eed7c179dccfe885.zip

Also editing to add: This same issue is on the linked devices screen. I don’t remember if this was happening before this update or not. Me using the increased contrast option is new.

While the backup is running the button below („Jetzt sichern“) restarts the backup process including the wait for preparing backup. I don’t think this makes sense, why would I want to restart the ongoing backup?

At 06:24 I tapped to the button so my backup restarted. Because it wasn’t completed the „last backup“ time should not update. Instead it should show the time of the last successful backup

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.79.0/544ccd2623b3f41fe11d2eb488d45e9dddfa440030c37ab9f9a21c453e70fd6d.zip

image1170×2532 246 KB

My backup upload pauses when I minimize Signal. I think this could be avoided by using the background task API on iOS26?

Apple Developer Documentation

Performing long-running tasks on iOS and iPadOS | Apple Developer Documentation

Use a continuous background task to do work that can complete as needed.

link_counts.title: Performing long-running tasks on iOS and iPadOS | Apple Developer Documentation

posts.name: Johannah
posts.cooked:
Congrats Signal Devs! The most requested feature for iOS is here!!

I noticed if the phone is in low power mode, the backup doesn’t complete unless the low power mode is turned off. Not sure how it’s supposed to handle this use case - but for now the user can tap the backup button while still in low power mode and the backup tries to complete but fails until the low power mode is turned off.

Steps:

  1. Ensure low power mode is enabled
  2. Go to backups screen in Signal
  3. Tap the backup button repeatedly
  4. Verify the backup continues to fail

It seems like this use case could be handled better, but not sure how.

See screenshot:

IMG_11301179×2556 230 KB
(post deleted by author)

posts.cooked:
IPad mini as linked device with my main Android device.

Is iPad not yet compatible with backup feature?

posts.name: Metronidazole
posts.cooked: With this beta build is it possible to transfer an account from an android phone to iOS and keep linked devices, messages, etc using the backup feature? I already have a paid backup plan on android

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Thanks guys! Testing immediately! Will the local version be out soon as well?

posts.name: Chloe
posts.cooked:
A few other problems I found in this release:

  • When an incorrect key is supplied, but the phone number has previously been registered on this device, the setup skips the “incorrect key” prompt, and instead jumps to pin entry (the prompt is only shown after pin entry). There is no way for the user to recover from this state if the pin is entered. Debug logs: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.79.0/cd5ea3f5ad150f50d167ce0ed0e5f1457d3d15a443187466112eca25d95d5125.zip

  • The “no backup key?” button and subsequent prompt tell the user to go to a setting that doesn’t exist on either iOS or Android. (Settings > Chats > Backup does not exist).

    • Side note: The prompt also says that the user can get the backup code from the settings if they still have the old device, but I wasn’t able to get the backup settings menu to open after being unregistered from my Android device (during my tests this was during my reregistration using backups, before I had entered the key into the iOS app). Is this intended behavior? I can view the code on an unregistered iOS device.

  • The restore from signal backups prompt is only given to the user on the first registration of the number. Android behaves differently, and asks every time if the number has been previously registered. The user has to press the restore button to be given this option if they previously registered this number with this device.

Cross-platform inconsistencies:

  • The backup code isn’t spaced every 4 characters on iOS (at least in the copied key), and is all lowercase, unlike Android’s all uppercase. I think lowercase makes it more readable and harder to confuse, but the behavior should be the same between platforms to prevent confusion if users switch platforms.

1. Upload pauses while app is in the background. Very unrealistic to leave the app open for a multi GB backup.
  2. Switching from full to 45 days plan, the spinner hangs for a minute.
  3. Where can I see a list of my backups?

posts.name: Bas de Bakker
posts.cooked:
I have the beta on my iPhone and on my linked iPad. Because I had to reset my iPhone in the past, my Signal history on my iPad goes back further than that on my iPhone. I only see the backup options in settings on my iPhone, not on my iPad.

Is there a way to get those older messages that are only on my linked iPad into my backup? If so, is there then a way to get them on my iPhone without doing a complete restore?

First of all, great work! Thank you for bringing this feature!

I restored everything successfully from a backup done on Android and then successfully relinked my iPad that’s on stable.

The only complaint I have is that in the initial screen that asks whether one has the old device only shows the restore option after selecting that the old device is lost.

This was quite confusing, because I still have my old Android device, but this made me go through the setup process twice.

For now I’ll cancel the backup plan on Android, cause I’m wiping that device, but I’ll be happy to subscribe again as this feature reaches stable on iOS.

Backup didn’t actually finish, progress bar disappeared, and the “last backup” is stated just now with backup size 8GB. This seems like bug of both incorrect reporting of last successful back up and the backup actually not finishing (and stopping). Would be beneficial to see a history list of successful backups.

I recently (last Thursday) pushed my backups from Android (stable client).

Attempting to restore them today on this build and every time I get a failure with the backup key. I’ve attempted direct entry and camera entry, neither work.

Each time I get an “Incorrect Recover Key” message. When clicking “Try Again” the restore procedure appears to give up.

Backup stopped (?) without an error message while Signal was opened. Time of last backup didn’t update

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.79.0/8dcd49eca845be904fba6d59ab4ad750c7e34f0d64a0f96e659d9810ab8bd02c.zip

Edit: restarting the backup finished in <30s and the time of the last backup was updated.

Dear developers thank you so very much, I can finally backup all those precious memories!

In part, this is a workaround for the fact that Apple doesn’t let TestFlight builds do real-money transactions using their In-App Purchase system, which we’ll be using; it’s also a token of our appreciation for your work helping us make Signal better!

thanks a lot for this!!

Formatting of my restore key is inefficient and makes it necessary to scroll the screen which is unintuitive
